intro: Kickxia collenetteana, commonly known as the Collenette's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. Kickxia collenetteana is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of 20 to 40 centimeters.
